commentBody:
Here's my problem with the Times -- the idea of "on the one hand, maybe yes, on the other hand maybe no" journalism.

Bannon either IS or IS NOT racist and anti-Semitic. He either DID or DID not publish racist and anti-Semitic comments on Breitbart.

(Hint: Five minutes on Google will show you that he DID.)

Since Bannon IS racist and IS ant-Senitic, it's OK to say that in the active voice, and not hide behind "on the one hand, on the other hand" journalism.

"Fair" and "Balanced" shouldn't mean that the actual truth gets lost behind your qualifiers and modifiers.
